intro: Nephelium lappaceum var. pallens, commonly known as the white langsat, is a variant of the langsat fruit native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its pale yellow to white rind and sweet, juicy pulp. The plant is a small evergreen tree belonging to the Sapotaceae family. It thrives in tropical climates with high humidity and well-drained soil. The fruit is typically harvested when fully mature, and it is valued for its unique flavor and nutritional content.
